ngoList.title: BLANK VERSE
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Blank Verse, though younger in age and experience, feels that the present Youth is by and large trapped in a paradoxical situation as he finds himself increasingly engulfed by the dark forces of Obscurantism, Disintegration and Violence. Pathetically true, he is somehow confused without idealism, traumatized with terror, and listless about his responsibility. On the one hand, he is being continuously misled to understand his own Origin, thanks to the open sky â€˜mass cultureâ€™; he is being robbed off his own creative passion by the overwhelming panic of terrorism. On the other, scientific and technological openings are challenging him to take up the cudgel and a creative leap into the 21st century. In more specific cultural terms, the Youth is confronted with the choice between re-discovery of his tradition and identity in the modern context and a passive surrender to this present socio-political milieu. In this circumstance, it is our pious task to help the Youth believe in themselves, to help them analyze and understand the world around and its changeability, to help them achieve some creative passion, to help them reach some awareness about our age old Culture, Art & Philosophy, to bring back their confidence that they can really control their own lives and are capable of changing their environment, to help them become the AGENTS OF THE FUTURE. Blank Verse is working regularly with children & elders, coming from various lifestyles, for a couple of years. Then the dream of practicing Theatre has cropped up. Our first production, FURRUT, based on a story by Upendra Kishore Roychowdhury, premiered in the Odeonâ€™06 by Hutchison Telecom Ltd., the play has taken part in Jasnebachpan, 2006 by the T. I. E. Company of National School of Drama, Banga Sanskriti Utsav by the Presidency College Alumni Association, Mumbai, Nandikarâ€™s National Theatre Festivalâ€™06, Natyamela â€™06 of the Govt. of West Bengal and also in the every major theatre festival in West Bengal. Everywhere the play stole the show and collected an immense audience support. The second play, Kanaichand Palowan allows us to form a new kind of theatre on the square of proscenium. Running regularly at Kolkata successfully, the play has also partaken in Jasnebachpan, 2008, by the T. I. E. Company of National School of Drama, New Delhi, and various children theatre fests around the state. Bhootum Bhagaban, the third play basically emphasizes on the power of truth and belief. The play has been premiered in Jasnebachpan, 2009, by the T. I. E. Company of National School of Drama, New Delhi and also locally at Kolkata in Odeonâ€™09, organized by Vodafone Essar East Limited. The play also has partaken in Visva Bharati Theatre Festival, Shantiniketan in last spring and collected rare applause. The play, Aal Izz Well is on the issue of Juvenile Offence, where we are trying to find our responsibility of being elder and importance of being earnest. We are trying hard to communicate the pangs and agony of Children of some obscure darkness. The play has also partaken in Jashnebachpan2010.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We set up four blind schools in West Bengal out of which one (Louis Braille Memorial School for the Sightless at Uttarpara, Hooghly) has been sponsored by the state government. Another school (Helen Keller Smriti Vidyamandir at Krishnanagar, Nadia) receives grants from Ministry of Social Justice under Deen Dayal Scheme. We conduct a Braille press and library, Lal Bihari Shah Braille Academia, Vidyapalli, Malancha-Mahinagar, Kolkata â€“ 700145. We provide Braille books to sightless individuals at Rs.10 per Braille volume from the Academia. We organise and encourage participation of sightless people in social activities through blood donation camps, relief collection during natural calamities, etc. We organise seminars and exhibitions for developing awareness about blindness and blind peopleâ€™s problems. Only sightless people can become members. Innumerable volunteers help the Association without remuneration. We try to build up exemplary characters among the sightless that the society can truly recognise their worth and accept them with honour and dignity.

ngoList.title: BOHURUPEE
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: BOHURUPEE, regarded as the pioneer organization has an uninterrupted history of creative endeavour and stage productions,being established by the doyen of modern Indian theatre Sri Sombhu Mitra in 1948. Bohurupee has successfully staged plays of Rabindranath Tagore like Raktakarabi, Char Adhayay, Visarjan, Raja, Malini, Muktadhara and others. It has produced plays of great foreign playwrights, Sophocles, Ibsen, Tchekov, O Neil, Brecht, Anouilh, Sartre and Sanskrit classic Mrichchakatik of Sudrak along with the plays of established Indian playwrights like Tulsi Lahiri, Manmatha Roy, Sombhu Mitra, Badal Sarkar, Vijoy Tendulkar, Girish Karnard, Buddhadev Basu, Manoj Mitra, Sisir Kumar Das and also of the new generation playwrights. Bohurupee has been taking initiative in providing a base for meaningful interaction among various cultures in the country. Bohurupee organizes a theatre festival each year to celebrate its anniversary where new productions of Bohurupee as well as productions from theatre groups from other states are staged. Bohurupee organizes seminars and invites speeches from eminent theatre personalities and educationalists. It also organizes theatre workshops and classes for the new generation theatre workers. Bohurupee travels with its productions in the different states in the country and Bangladesh with a view to exchange the cultural activities. Bohurupee publishes a biyearly theatre journal since 1955 which has proved to be one of the longest running journals in its own domain. It is our great pride that late Sombhu Mitra had been awarded Padmabhushan, Sangeet Natak Award, Magsaysay Award, Kalidas Samman and others. Late Tripti Mitra had been awarded Padmasree, Sangeet Natak Award, Dinabandhu Purashkar, Kalidas Samman and others. Late Kumar Roy was also awarded Sangeet Natak Award and Dinabandhu Purashkar. The awards were achieved for their valuable contribution for theatre through Bohurupee.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The responsibilities and duties of Democratic Government is well defined in their respective Constitution. But the performance of a State so far as constitutional obligations to their Citizens are far from satisfactory. One can not blame the failures of performances entirely on the Government shoulders alone. In this age of globalisation, Government is found to be overburdened despite their sincere desire and will to translate their ideas and responsibilities into action. There remain always a huge gap between the Government and the people so far as benefits of the welfare State to make them reachable to the just destination. Instances may be cited from the various fields of Governmental activities where Government can not serve properly according to the defined objectives of this State. As for example: Rural Sanitation, Health & Hygiene, Micro-financial benefits, Universal education, Womwn trafficking, Early marriage, Child abuse and many others. Without peopleâ€™s active and meaningful participation, no Government can claim their success for the aforesaid programmes. Here comes the necessity of forming NGOs for implementation of Government programmess and constitutional obligation towards the citizen. A Nation can not achieve their goal entirely by the Government machineries alone. The gap between the shortcomings of the Government and welfare of the Nation should be narrowed to the desired end by the activities of NGOs. NGOs can play a very big and effective role to create a prosperous Nation by their sincere participation in various nation-building activities. Nation-building activities does not necessarily mean only physical welbeing of the people. The word,â€˜Nation Buildingâ€™ include man-making activities too. Only a perfect man can do justice to the welbeing of the Nation. The NGOs should take allout attempts to link their activities with man-making mission positively without which the result of the Developmental programmes will bound to suffer. With each of the activities of NGOs, the true human approach should be linked up, if NGOs want to play a big and successful role to the nation-building activities to which our NGO, Boysâ€™ Recreation Club, is engaged at present. The Boysâ€™ Recreation Club started functioning in 1965 with the sole object of all round development of village, the detailed description of which has been embodied in the Club Constitution. The Boysâ€™ Recreation Club is a registered Organisation under the Society Registration Act of the Government of West Bengal on 10th january, 1980 and also attain the Registration of Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, 1976 of the Ministry of Home Affairs under Government of India on 28th February, 2008. Since itâ€™s formation, the Club started functioning and atpresent involved in several socio- economic activities which are not only limited within the village where the club building situated but is spread far and wide. Since itâ€™s formation BRC has played a pivotal role in performing various social activities specially among the poor, distressed and the backward classes of the society like schedule Caste / schedule Tribes in Cooch Behar district. The organisation is engaged in performing humantarian services with an aim to extricate poverty and illiteracy from the poor, neglected and other deprived sections of the society and to provide various welfare measures for these people through multidimensional and socio-economic activities in order to improve and elevate their living standard. It has been a constant endeavour of some highly enthusiastic and light minded people to form a nonprofit making organisation to extend extensive services among the socially, backward and economically deprived section of the society. The organisation is committed to empower the people and facilitate the process of their self-reliance. The thrust of BRC on the issues are : I) all round development of village through socio-economic activities, ii) To build capacity, social responsisbility & to promote income generating programme. Iii) To empower rural people sicially and economically by upgrading their condition iv) Organising the unorganised people and stregthening the existing peopleâ€™s Organization and Self Help Group. V) Promotion of grass root organisation. The activities in which the Club is at present engaged may be described under the following Heads at a glance:- 1) Rural sanitation Programme (UNICEF Project) 2) Total Sanitation Campaign (UNICEF Project) 3) Safe Drinking Water (UNICEF Project) 4) Water Testing laboratory (UNICEF Project) 5) Self Help Group (SHGs) (NABARD Project) 6) Micro Finance (Bank Project) 7) Youth Development Centre (NYK, Govt. of India) 8) Computer Tr. Centre (NYK, Govt. of India) 9) Gramin Yuba Utsab (Govt. India) 10) Public Library (Govt. of W.B.) 11) Disaster Management (Govt. of West Bengal) 12) Micro-Insurance (CNRI & LIC ) 13) Vocational Training ( NYK & Community Polytechnic Cell) 14) Ambulance Service (Public-private partnership, GTZ-KFW) 15) Social forestry (District & Local Administration) 16) Pulse Polio Immunization (District & Local Administration) 17) AIDS Awareness (District & Local Administration) 18) National Rural Employment Gurantee Programme (NREGP) 19) Low-cost Oxygen Service (Own Fund) 20) Homeopathy Charity (Own fund) 21) Student welfare (Own Fund) 22) Felicitation ceremony (Own Fund) 23) Women Day observation (Own Fund) 24) Children Park (Own Fund) 25) Publication of Annual Magazine & Sharad Sankha (Own Fund) 26) Construction of Community Hall & Auditorium (Own Fund) 27) Promotion of grass roots Organisation (Different Funding Agencies) 28) Construction of Ferro Cement water Filter (UNICEF Project) 30) Soil Testing Laboratory (proposed) (UNICEF Project) 29) Nursing Training School (proposed) (Public-private partnership, Health Dept. Govt. of W.B.) Special Distinction & Impact. As a result of our activities, Socio-economic condition of our area of operation (4 Block) has undergone sea of changes especially the upliftment of women folk is noticable. In the field of Rural Health, Sanitation programme undertaken by our organisation is benefited much especially the water-borne diseases has declined to a greater extent. The Water Testing Laboratory of our organisation has started functioning which has great impact for eradication of Water-borne diseases. In this connection, mention may be made about Six Nirmal Gram which has been declared by the Health department, Govt. of India. This was possible for the active participation of our organisation in the Total Sanitation campaign. We have achieved a special place of honour in this State as a result of successful implementation of the activities mentioned earlier. We have received the State Level Outstanding Youth Club Award by Nehru Yuba Kendra, West Bengal Zone, Kolkata for the year 2001-2002 in recognition of our outstanding services in the field of welfare. We have received and still receiving funds from state level funding agencies as well as central Level funding agencies and other sources.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Chandabilla Loka Bharati Loka Nritya Sanstha envisions revival of the dying cultural traditions related to folk music, fold song ang folk drama and believers that only through holistic development it is possible to create a society where basic needs of every individual like food, shelter, health, education and employment are met and where justice, liberty, equality and security is guaranteed for all. Chandabilla Loka Bharati Loka Nritya Sanstha strives to empower the underprivileged and vulnerable sections of society â€“ especially women and children â€“ for holistic and sustainable development through a rights based approach regardless of caste, creed and gender. FOLK DANCES Patna, kathi, Karma, Dhali, Raibensi, Ran Pa, tusu, Kalshi, Chou, Purulia Chou and Adibashi folk festival. NRITYA NATYA Sathi Daha Pala, Parijat Puspaharan etc. FOLK SONG Panta, Tusu, Bhadu, jhumur, Baul and Jaowa songs.

ngoList.actName: West Bengal Societies Registration Act XXVI of 1961
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Chandannagar Paribesh Unnayan Samity is a leading environmental organisation in Hooghly district,West Bengal,India working out various environmental promotional and protective programmes in Chandannagar and surrounding areas.Our year-round work schedule comprises of Awareness programmes ,namely ,seminars ,meetings in schools ,colleges,padayatras(rally) ,exhibitions ,debates and public speaking competitions for school and collage students ,publication and literature including a-bilingual annual magazine with valuable contributions from eminent environment scientists ,conferring "PARIBESH BANDHU"(The friend of environment) to the best environment activists in the localities each year.All these are intended for spreading environmental message to the citizens. Action programmes namely campaign against anti-plastic carry bag use ,anti-air horn use ,garbage clearance ,waste management ,vat construction ,sale of vermi-manures ,awarding "Jagadhatri Puja Paribesh Shiromani "trophy to the best puja committees among 115 of them judged on the basis of some environment norms every year , large scale tree plantation(more than 1000 in last 10 years) ,setting up herbal and flower gardens etc for motivating people to voluntary work. Negotiation programmes namely taking up the environmental issues and problems with the Municipal authorities ,Police ,Sub Divisional Officer ,District Magistrate ,Savadhipati ,WBPCB etc as the case requires. As in the previous years ,this year too ,we are going to celebrate WORLD ENVIRONMENT DAY on 5th June 2010 on the occasion of which we are going to publish our annual magazine with "SUSTHA PARIBESH".Last year ,the then Governor Sri Gopal Krishna Gandhi sent and excellent for our magazine.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Our major activities are in digital literacy, after-school education support, promoting ICT-based enterprises for women and raising environment awareness. Our main achievement is in community mobilisation for Government of India National Digital Literacy Mission project. In both the phases of NDLM, we had crossed the targets for digital literacy much ahead of time and have been awarded for our efforts.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Remedial classes for 45 students at Canning. The students are in Class 1 to Class 10. They are all first-generation learners. So the need guidance for their day-to-day study. Our initiative helps the students to continue with their study. We also run the Niharika Primary School at Ranaghat. 30 students are studying at the school. The progress has been remarkable. Students are also participating in extra-curricular activities.

Change Initiatives undertook Digital Literacy under Government of India National Digital Literacy Mission Project. We had set up a digital literacy centre at Mahishgote. We trained around 300 to 400 in digital literacy during this period. The training was given to one person per family in the age group of 14 to 60 years. The trainees had to give online exam at Government of India NDLM portal, managed by CSC. They were then given certificates.

The first phase of Government of India National Digital Litearcy Mission (NDLM) project has ended. Our centre was at Mahishgote. We enrolled 1,417 and trained 1,417. As many as 994 students gave their exams, of which 972 passed. The trainees were in the age group 14 years and 60 years. One person per family were taken up for training. The students gave their exams in Government of India portal and they also received certificates from the government.

Training in Digital Literacy under Government of India National Digital Literacy Mission. We enrolled 1417 for training, and we trained 1417 in digital litearcy. Exams were given by 994, of which 972 passed. We trained one person per family in the age group 14 years to 60 years. Participants trained in basics of computer, internet, tablets and how to use internet through mobile phones. Online exams were held through a government portal and those who passed received certificates.

After-school remedial classes in Canning. We offer classes to 45 students. The students study from Class 1 to Class 10. They come from very poor families and their parents have not gone to school. The students are unable to get study support at home. They thus need guidance for their daily studies. Support also provided to Niharika Primary School at Ranaghat. Thirty students are studying and they are making remarakable progress. The students come to classes regularly.

Primary school at Ranaghat called Niharika Primary School, which is run by Change Initiatives. This is under our Kisholoy project. The school has thirty students and the progress has been very good. Students are attending classes regularly. They are not only studying but also participating in other co curricular activities. Teachers are als0 getting various exposure under this project to upgrade themselves.

Remedial classes for 45 students at Canning. Students are from a remote rural region and come from poor families. They are also first generation learners, and need study support at home. Apart from teaching, we provide books and tiffin to the students. Students come from Class 1 to Class 10. With the support they are able to continue their studies. Support also given to 30 students at Ranaghat to the students of Niharika Primary School. Books and tiffin are provided to the students.

The first phase of Government of India National Digital Litearcy Mission (NDLM) project has ended. Our centre was at Mahishgote. We enrolled 1,417 and trained 1,417. As many as 994 students gave their exams, of which 972 passed. The trainees were in the age group 14 years and 60 years. One person per family were taken up for training. The students gave their exams in Government of India portal and they also received certificates from the government.

The second phase of our digital literacy programme started. Our target was to enroll 1,250 to our digital litearcy mission programme. The centre was set up at Muchibajar, near Ultadanga. We also set up a small library, where trainees could upgrade themselves. Till March, we trained almost 400 people in digital litearcy. The students were taught basics of computer and internet, and how to handle the internet on mobile phone and computer. We followed government curriculum for the project,

Project to mentor women undergraduate students studying science, technology, engineering and mathematics, called STEM. Change Initiatives will mentor around 25 women studying in Kolkata colleges. Mentoring is in leadership, self awareness, career path and resilience. Programme supported by American Centre, Kolkata. Students should carry on with their studies.

Digital literacy for people in the age group 14 years to 60 years. Till October, 1204 students have been enrolled. Training has been provided to 1204 students. Exams have been held for 1082, while 1082 have passed. The trainees learned the basics of computer, internet. mobiles and tablets. The aim is to ensure they can apply the internet in their day to day lives. The students gave their exams online. They also received certificates. The training centre was at Muchibajar, Kolkata.

After school remedial classes at Canning. Teaching to 45 students. The students are first generation learners. Their parents are not literate and cannot provide any study support. The initiative gives them an opportunity to study. The students study from Class 1 to Class 10. Support to Niharika Primary School at Ranaghat. There are 30 students in the school. Progress has been remarkable. The students not only study but also participate in extra curricular activities.
Mentoring 25 science students from Guahati colleges to build sustainable career in STEM.

Digital literacy training to 1,250 in Kolkata in the age group 14-60.. Centre at Beliaghata. Trainees learned basics of internet, email, social media at the training centre. After that they give an online exams.
